title: Integrative Approach to Online Learning Design and Mindfulness: A Case Study in Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical knowledge and online learning experience
context.additional_context: Mathematics education program for office/administrative professionals, operating with formative assessments in BYOD environments and requiring intermediate domain expertise

learning_goals: Learners can visually analyze the relationship between online math learning design elements and mindfulness using concept mapping
Learners can evaluate mindfulness cases demonstrated in peers' online learning design processes through critical incident interviews
Learners can develop action plans to enhance flexibility and openness when designing online math instruction by applying metacognitive strategies
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
